channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The council has been marked in 2 areas of Manor Way. No repair has been completed, 30th November
item.description:
This issue was reported September. I assume the 2 marked areas of damaged pavement Manor Way is for repair dates? No repairs have been completed yet. When will this work be completed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Way, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kasher Joinery bins are full, 30th November
item.description:
Bins are full and trash is all over the pavement! Council needs to keep the area clean for residents.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 227-255, Ilderton Road, Bermondsey, Greater London

item.title: Drain cover, 30th November
item.description:
The drain cover it loose, and with this being a busy road with lots of cars day and night it’s causing a very loud noise everytime a car drives over it
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Longleigh Lane, Bexleyheath
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lighting not working, 30th November
item.description:
Hi, The street lights from approx no 72 Adley Street to where the street meets Meeson St. Lights are not working leaving the street v dark at night. I have noticed this for some time now and initially thought it might just be a temporary problem.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Adley Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: All out - three or more street lights in a row

item.title: Gravel hill recent accident on 28/11, 30th November
item.description:
Reference to the accident at the bottom of gravel hill on 28/11, on the carriageway over the A2 at the black princess, l have noticed recently that car are doing a U turn were the Ballards are missing near Bexley rugby club this opening should be closed with concrete Ballards to stop cars from doing U turn hopefully this would stop any further accidents in
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bourne Road, Bexley, Greater London

item.title: The sign outside the council office has been replaced, 30th November
item.description:
The sign was damaged about 4 weeks ago and still has not been replaced, as it was stated when it was first reported l was told it would be replaced within 4 week
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Watling Street, Barnehurst, Greater London

item.title: Stolen bikes outside 44a house every day. The boys living there are stealing bikes constantly and selling them from there., 30th November
item.description:
The police/council need to do something about these boys, constantly stealing bikes from hard working people, littering, scaring locals, shouting abuse at passers-by for no reason. Why aren't they in school and why are they allowed to continue stealing bikes? Horrible people.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Lyndhurst Grove, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Littering, fly tipping residential waste, 30th November
item.description:
The pavements outside the properties along that stretch of Barnabas Road are constantly littered, often litter is thrown with no bin bags, it’s both a health hazard and a very unpleasant experience for anyone accessing Homerton station.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Barnabas Road, London
